definitions: long thin pole or rod used as handle or structural support
vertical or inclined passage in mine or building for access or ventilation
narrow beam of light passing through opening or from bright source
examples: The miner descended into the mine through the main shaft
He gripped the shaft of the golf club tightly
The elevator moves smoothly up and down the building's central shaft
Workers were trapped when the mine shaft collapsed yesterday
A shaft of sunlight pierced through the dusty attic window
Golden shafts of light filtered through the cathedral's stained glass

definitions: hairstyle with long rough layers cut at uneven lengths creating shaggy appearance
strong coarse cut tobacco typically used for hand rolled cigarettes
carpet or rug with long thick rough pile creating deep textured surface
examples: The rock star's signature shag gave him a wild, rebellious appearance
She asked the hairdresser for a modern shag with lots of layers
Grandfather always kept a pouch of shag in his jacket pocket
The shop sells various types of shag for pipe smoking enthusiasts
The living room features a plush shag in warm earth tones
My parents still have that orange shag from the seventies

definitions: systematic search of person or place for contraband or hidden items
initial test run or trial period to identify problems in new equipment
act of extorting money through threats or pressure typically by criminals
examples: The guards conducted a shakedown of all cells looking for weapons
Airport security performed a thorough shakedown of suspicious luggage
The ship needs a shakedown cruise before its maiden voyage
We'll run a shakedown of the new system this weekend
The shopkeeper reported the shakedown attempt to local police immediately
Protection rackets often involve regular shakedowns of business owners

definitions: container with perforated lid used for dispensing salt pepper or mixing drinks
member of religious sect known for ecstatic worship and simple communal living
mechanical device that creates vibration for testing or separating materials
examples: Pass me the salt shaker from across the dining table
The bartender vigorously mixed the cocktail in a metal shaker
The Shaker community produced beautifully simple furniture and crafts
Few active Shaker communities remain in the United States today
Engineers use a shaker table to test equipment durability
The paint shaker ensures thorough mixing of colors and base

definitions: rapid back and forth movement causing vibration or trembling of object or person
action of moving something vigorously to mix agitate or dislodge contents
examples: The shaking of the earthquake lasted for nearly thirty seconds
His nervous shaking was visible as he approached the podium
The shaking of the bottle helps dissolve the medicine completely
Vigorous shaking separated the cream from the fresh milk

definitions: fine grained sedimentary rock formed from compressed mud that splits easily into thin layers
examples: The cliff face revealed distinct layers of gray shale
Oil companies extract natural gas from deep shale formations

definitions: something false or fake intended to deceive or give misleading impression
decorative covering for pillow that matches bedding ensemble
examples: The expensive watch turned out to be a cheap sham
Their marriage was a sham maintained only for appearances
She removed the pillow shams before going to bed each night
The bedroom set includes matching shams and a duvet cover

definitions: person regarded as having access to spirit world who practices healing divination and ritual
examples: The tribal shaman performed a healing ceremony for the sick child
Many cultures rely on shamans for spiritual guidance and medicine

definitions: religious practice involving practitioner reaching altered states to interact with spirit world
examples: Shamanism remains an important spiritual tradition in many indigenous cultures
She studied shamanism during her anthropological research in Siberia

definitions: liquid soap formulated specifically for washing hair and scalp
cleaning solution designed for washing carpets rugs or upholstery
examples: This shampoo works well for oily hair and dandruff control
She forgot to pack shampoo for the weekend trip
The carpet shampoo removed most of the stubborn stains effectively
Professional cleaners use industrial shampoo for deep carpet cleaning

definitions: small clover plant with three leaves used as symbol of Ireland
examples: She wore a shamrock pin on Saint Patrick's Day
Fields of shamrocks covered the Irish countryside in spring

definitions: drink made by mixing beer with lemonade or other soft drink
examples: He ordered a refreshing shandy on the hot summer afternoon
The pub serves traditional shandy made with local ale

definitions: lower part of leg between knee and ankle or cut of meat from this area
straight narrow part of tool nail or fastener between head and point
examples: The butcher recommended lamb shanks for the winter stew recipe
He injured his shank during the soccer match yesterday
The drill bit broke at the shank during heavy use
Make sure the shank fits properly into the tool holder

definitions: small roughly built dwelling typically in poor area made from scrap materials
rhythmic work song originally sung by sailors while performing shipboard tasks
examples: Families lived in makeshift shanties along the riverbank
The hurricane destroyed hundreds of shanties in the coastal area
The crew sang sea shanties while hauling up the anchor
Traditional shanties helped sailors coordinate their physical labor

definitions: machine or tool used to cut shape or form materials into desired forms
person who influences or determines the development of something
examples: The woodworker used a shaper to create decorative moldings
This industrial shaper can handle large metal workpieces
She was a key shaper of modern educational policy
Technology shapers influence how society adopts new innovations

definitions: process of giving particular form or shape to material or object
act of influencing or determining the nature or direction of something
examples: The shaping of clay requires patience and skilled hands
Metal shaping involves various techniques like forging and pressing
Parents play a crucial role in shaping children's values
Economic factors are shaping the future of the industry

definitions: sharp piece of broken glass ceramic pottery or other brittle material
examples: She carefully swept up the shards from the broken window
Archaeologists found pottery shards dating back two thousand years

definitions: person who owns shares in a company giving them partial ownership rights
examples: Shareholders voted to approve the proposed merger at yesterday's meeting
As a shareholder, she receives quarterly dividend payments

definitions: shares owned by individual or organization representing ownership stake in company
examples: His shareholding in the company increased to fifteen percent
Large shareholdings give investors more influence over company decisions

definitions: computer software distributed free on trial basis with payment required for continued use
examples: The developer released the game as shareware to attract users
Many utilities started as shareware before becoming commercial products

definitions: religious law forming part of Islamic tradition derived from religious precepts of Islam
examples: The court applies sharia in matters of family law
Different countries interpret sharia principles in various ways

definitions: religious law forming part of Islamic tradition derived from religious precepts of Islam
examples: Shariah governs many aspects of Muslim religious and daily life
Banks offer shariah compliant financial products to Muslim customers

definitions: act of using enjoying or experiencing something jointly with others
process of dividing and distributing something among people
examples: Sharing toys helps children learn important social skills
The sharing of resources reduced costs for both companies
Fair sharing ensures everyone receives an equal portion
Digital sharing of files has transformed how we exchange information

definitions: person who cheats or swindles others especially through gambling or confidence tricks
examples: The card sharper was banned from every casino in town
Police warned tourists about sharpers operating near the station

definitions: person skilled in shooting who consistently hits targets with great accuracy
examples: The military unit included several highly trained sharpshooters
She earned recognition as the team's best sharpshooter

definitions: action or sound of breaking suddenly into many pieces
extremely upsetting or devastating emotional or psychological impact
examples: The shattering of glass alerted neighbors to the break in
The sudden shattering startled everyone in the quiet library
News of his death had a shattering effect on the family
The shattering of her dreams left her deeply depressed

definitions: act of removing hair from face or body using razor or similar tool
very thin slice or fragment removed from surface of something
examples: His morning shave takes about ten minutes with preparation
She scheduled a shave at the barbershop before the wedding
Add a shave of chocolate on top of the dessert
The carpenter removed a thin shave from the door edge

definitions: electric or manual device designed for removing hair by cutting close to skin
informal term for young person especially a boy
examples: He bought a new electric shaver for his travels
The battery powered shaver works well for quick touch ups
The little shaver helped his grandfather in the garden
Young shavers lined up excitedly for baseball tryouts

definitions: act or process of removing hair with razor or act of cutting thin layers
thin strip or piece cut or scraped from surface of material
examples: Daily shaving irritates his sensitive skin considerably
The barber shop offers traditional hot towel shaving services
Wood shavings covered the workshop floor after hours of carving
Metal shavings must be cleaned up for safety reasons

definitions: piece of fabric worn around shoulders or head for warmth or decoration
examples: She draped her grandmother's silk shawl over her shoulders
The traditional shawl featured intricate hand embroidered patterns

definitions: light two wheeled carriage for one or two people popular in 18th century
examples: The museum displays a restored shay from colonial times
They rode through the park in an antique shay

definitions: bundle of grain stalks laid lengthwise and tied together after reaping
bundle or collection of things typically papers held or tied together
examples: Farmers gathered wheat into sheaves for easier transport
The painting depicted workers carrying sheaves across golden fields
She carried a sheaf of documents to the meeting
The lawyer shuffled through a thick sheaf of contracts

definitions: force that causes layers or parts to slide upon each other in opposite directions
large scissors or cutting tool used for cutting cloth metal or plants
examples: The bridge collapsed due to excessive shear stress
Engineers calculate shear forces when designing building structures
Garden shears work best for trimming thick branches
The tailor used shears to cut the heavy fabric

definitions: person who cuts wool from sheep using hand shears or electric clippers
machine used for cutting especially in mining or agriculture
examples: The experienced shearer could process fifty sheep per day
Professional shearers travel between farms during shearing season
The coal shearer cuts through rock layers in the mine
Modern shearers have replaced much manual mining labor

definitions: process of cutting wool from sheep or similar animals
action of force that causes or tends to cause deformation by slippage
examples: Shearing happens once or twice yearly depending on the breed
The shearing shed buzzed with activity during spring
The earthquake caused significant shearing in the building's structure
Metal shearing requires specialized industrial equipment

definitions: large scissors with long blades used for cutting various materials
examples: The gardener pruned roses with sharp pruning shears
Heavy duty shears can cut through thick metal sheets

definitions: close fitting cover for blade of knife or sword
protective covering that fits closely around something
examples: He drew the knife from its leather sheath
The ceremonial sword rested in an ornate sheath
The cable runs through a protective plastic sheath
Nerve fibers are surrounded by a myelin sheath

definitions: protective casing or covering placed around something
boards or sheets of material used to cover frame of building
examples: The wire needs proper sheathing to prevent electrical hazards
Rubber sheathing protects underwater cables from corrosion
Workers installed plywood sheathing before adding the siding
The sheathing provides structural support and weather protection

definitions: simple single story structure used for storage or shelter typically in garden
process of dropping losing or getting rid of something naturally
examples: Tools and lawn equipment filled the garden shed
The old shed needs a new roof before winter
The snake's shed of its skin happens several times yearly
Trees begin their annual shed of leaves in autumn

definitions: process of losing or dropping something naturally or deliberately
natural process of animals losing fur feathers or skin
examples: The shedding of old habits takes time and patience
Companies are shedding jobs to reduce operating costs
Spring shedding leaves fur all over the furniture
Regular brushing helps control your pet's shedding

definitions: soft luster or shine on a surface giving it a smooth gleaming appearance
examples: The silk dress had a beautiful sheen in the light
He polished the car until it had a perfect sheen

definitions: dog trained to guard and herd sheep typically breeds like collies or shepherds
examples: The sheepdog guided the flock back to the pen
Border collies make excellent sheepdogs due to their intelligence

definitions: marine fish with vertical black stripes and teeth resembling sheep
trick taking card game played with partial deck popular in certain regions
examples: Anglers prize sheepshead for their fighting ability and taste
The sheepshead feeds on shellfish using its strong teeth
They gathered weekly to play sheepshead at the local tavern
Sheepshead requires strategy and careful card counting

definitions: skin of sheep with wool on used for clothing rugs or other items
informal term for diploma or degree certificate traditionally written on parchment
examples: The pilot wore a jacket lined with warm sheepskin
Sheepskin rugs add comfort to hardwood floors
After four years, she finally earned her sheepskin
He proudly displayed his sheepskin on the office wall

definitions: cotton or linen fabric used for making bed sheets
material in form of broad thin surface or layer
examples: She bought soft cotton sheeting to make new pillowcases
The store offers sheeting in various thread counts
Plastic sheeting covered the furniture during painting
Metal sheeting forms the roof of the warehouse

definitions: Arab leader ruler or chief of tribe or family group
examples: The sheik welcomed visitors to his desert encampment
Local sheiks met to discuss regional water rights

definitions: leader of Arab family group village or tribe
religious leader or Islamic scholar respected for knowledge and piety
examples: The sheikh ruled over several villages in the region
Business leaders met with the sheikh to discuss investments
Students gathered to hear the sheikh explain religious texts
The sheikh leads prayers at the central mosque

definitions: basic monetary unit of Israel divided into 100 agorot
ancient unit of weight and money used in Middle East
examples: The price was fifty shekels at the Jerusalem market
Exchange rates show the shekel strengthening against the dollar
Archaeological finds included silver shekels from biblical times
Ancient texts mention payment of thirty shekels
